children.subject: There weren't when I took it last semester. It was a fun class! Granted, everyone was taking it because they had to, but there were a lot of really interesting discussions.

I don't think there's ever been big exams to my knowledge...but there usually is some weekly work like the student answer said.

Some instructors are more strict than others, but do expect to need to be there and do the work. It's not really a class you can miss.

Good luck on TAing! :)
Also, are there exams and things like that?

history.content:
The class is P/NP.  When I took it with Professor Rao, I spent about an average of an hour a week (often less later in the semester) outside of class working on the various assignments.  There aren't any "exams" per se, but there were in-class "quizzes" that weren't checked or turned in and that the class worked on together.  Since the class was relatively small, Prof. Rao knew most of us and had a pretty good idea of who did and did not show up, although I don't know how that affected final grades -- but attendance and all the assignments (submitted via Piazza) were technically required.  

Of course this likely varies depending on who's teaching the class.

history.subject: Is CS375 a P/NP class and how many hours per week is needed for it?
